We're up to our old tricks, but this time the former victims are seeing through us:
 
 http://www.chron.com/disp/story.mpl/ap/fn/3820388.html
 
 How could any country accept an open trade agreement when the US taxpayer is subsidizing a product with $17-billion? With the exception of Columbia, recipient of billions of military aid to 'fight' drugs and keep the regime in power, our tame S. American dictators are all but gone.

We're up to our old tricks, but this time the former victims are seeing through us:
 
 http://www.chron.com/disp/story.mpl/ap/fn/3820388.html
 
 How could any country accept an open trade agreement when the US taxpayer is subsidizing a product with $17-billion? With the exception of Columbia, recipient of billions of military aid to 'fight' drugs and keep the regime in power, our tame S. American dictators are all but gone.

 
 They don't. We have been bound by treaty and promising to remove farming subsidies since 1992. 
 
 
 I think those folks are just ungrateful, the whole lot of them. We gave them guys like Pinochet and Noriega to show them the wonders of the capitalist system, ran death squads in El Salvadore to help wipe out the evil socialists, and now, after we did all that for them, they turn agiunst us. Savages.
 
 What shoulod REALLY be a wakeup call for those who are still harboring the image of a strong America is the failure of the coup against Chavez. If you can't even pull off a coup in venezuela, you have truly become a paper tiger.
